snippet: Required since 1981 to break even, Amtrak’s food service never has, instead racking up huge losses, largely because of lack of oversight, waste and employee theft, according to government auditors.
abstract: Government auditors report that Amtrak lost more than $800 million on its food and beverage services over the last 10 years, largely because of waste, employee theft and lack of proper oversight.
lead_paragraph: Required since 1981 to break even, Amtrak’s food service never has, instead racking up huge losses, largely because of lack of oversight, waste and employee theft, according to government auditors.
